skill.name: brand-guidelines
skill.description: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit from having Anthropic's look-and-feel. Use it when brand colors or style guidelines, visual formatting, or company design standards apply.
skill.summary: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit fr...

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with no executable code in this directory. Only documentation and license text are present, so security risk is minimal.

content.value_statement: Your artifacts lack consistent Anthropic brand styling. This skill applies official colors and typography with smart fallbacks.
actual_capabilities: Apply Anthropic main and accent colors to artifacts
Apply Poppins to headings and Lora to body text
Fallback to Arial and Georgia when fonts are unavailable
Cycle accent colors for non-text shapes
Select text colors based on background for readability
Use RGB values compatible with python-pptx styling
limitations: Does not install fonts on the system
Limited to Anthropic color palette and typography rules
Requires an environment that supports font selection
Does not generate new content or layouts

use_cases.title: Brand compliant slides
use_cases.description: Style a slide deck to match Anthropic colors and typography before sharing with external partners.

use_cases.title: Consistent product mockups
use_cases.description: Apply official palette and fonts to mockups to keep internal reviews aligned with brand standards.

use_cases.title: Polished internal reports
use_cases.description: Format reports with approved fonts and colors for clear, consistent executive updates.

prompt_templates.title: Brand a slide deck
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Anthropic brand styling to this slide deck. Use official colors, Poppins for headings, and Lora for body text.

prompt_templates.title: Style a report
prompt_templates.prompt: Update this report to follow Anthropic brand colors and typography. Preserve hierarchy and readability.

prompt_templates.title: Apply palette with fallbacks
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Anthropic brand styling. Use Poppins and Lora if available, otherwise fall back to Arial and Georgia.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced slide styling
prompt_templates.prompt: Style this presentation with Anthropic brand colors. Cycle accent colors on non-text shapes and ensure text contrast on dark and light backgrounds.

output_examples.input: Apply Anthropic brand styling to this 6 slide pitch deck.
output: Headings set to Poppins for all titles above 24pt
Body text set to Lora with readable contrast on light backgrounds
Primary text uses Dark and Light brand colors as needed
Accent shapes rotate through orange, blue, and green

best_practices: Install Poppins and Lora fonts for best visual fidelity
Use light or dark backgrounds from the official palette
Review contrast after styling to ensure readability
anti_patterns: Using non brand fonts for headings or body text
Introducing off palette colors for accents or backgrounds
Ignoring contrast when switching between light and dark themes

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code
faq.answer: Yes, it provides brand styling guidance that works across Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: Does it install fonts automatically
faq.answer: No, you must install Poppins and Lora in your environment for best results.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into slide automation
faq.answer: Yes, the guidance aligns with tools such as python-pptx for automated styling.

faq.question: Does it store or transmit my data
faq.answer: No, it only provides styling guidance and does not handle data storage.

faq.question: What if my text becomes hard to read
faq.answer: Switch between light and dark brand backgrounds and verify contrast after styling.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic brand guides
faq.answer: It is specific to Anthropic colors and typography, not a general branding framework.
